Author: PartyTimeSexyDisco
Text: I can't really speak for people with OFSED but things like malnutrition, food anxiety, food neophobia spring to mind, and I think it's also entirely possible someone who fulfils not all the required criteria for other EDs will have most of the risks associated with them despite not having that specific diagnosis. For example, atypical anorexia ("normal" BMI anorexic) falls under this diagnostic unit, but only part of the health issues of anorexia are caused by low BMI, weighing more is not gonna help you avoid malnutrition, heart problems, social issues, secretive eating, possible b/p, etc. Tldr low weight is only one aspect of some EDs.
